page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY II
page.content: was established, firstly at GR.811555 (now the New Day Inn) then until present at GR.807554 - since 1929 Cambusnethan North Church.The Coltness Memorial Church was also endowed by the Holdsworth family in memory of the premature death of one of the family. 2.1839 the Holdsworth family textile manufacturers from England aquired the Coltness Estate. Coal mining then grew until by 1913 there were over 20 mines in the area. Today 1985 all that is left of these is a very small concern employing less than 10 people. The Coltness Iron Works was also set up (in its day the biggest manufacturer of wagon wheels and rolling stock in Britain) but it closed in 1948. This site is now occupied by the Costain Concrete Works. Bonkle(GR.836569) has 7 listed houses contained in the village.
